DOC.brief_title: Preventing Behavior Health Problems Foster Teens
DOC.detailed_description: The cost child welfare service U.S. estimate $ 20 billion per year . During past decade , number teenager foster care nearly double . Numerous study document adolescent high-risk develop serious problem , include substance use , participation health-risking sexual behavior , involvement juvenile justice system , serious educational problem school drop-out , fail placements/foster care `` drift '' homelessness . Yet , little research characteristic intervention use guide improvement service vulnerable population youngster . The propose study extend previous research adolescent refer serious behavioral emotional problem research elementary-aged child foster care test efficacy preventive intervention adolescent place foster kin care provider San Diego County Child Welfare System . Two hundred forty adolescent foster/kin care provider participate ( i.e. , 60 foster/kin parent training condition , 60 parent training plus youth skill train condition , 120 casework `` usual '' control condition ) . In addition test efficacy two level intervention , investigator propose examine effect intervention set youth behavioral health-related outcome . Parenting mediator test include positive parenting , parental supervision , non-harsh discipline . Youth mediator social competence , commitment school , knowledge norm relate health-risking behavior include substance use high-risk sexual behavior . In addition , theoretical hypothesis effect early risk/adversity factor youth outcome examine , economic analysis conduct examine relative benefit cost associate two level intervention .
DOC.criteria: Any child age 12 16 year relative nonrelative foster care Only medically fragile child
